description:
The freshman seminar will engage students in critical
thinking of Chinatowns in history and myth. What are
the stereotypes and perceptions of Chinatown among
people in the West and the East? What are the facts
and what are the misconceptions? How have
Chinatowns evolved over time? What is the fate of
Chinatowns in this changing world? Students will
investigate the representation of the Chinese and the
Chinatowns through historical accounts, novels,
poetry, photographs, cartoons, films, and personal
memory, etc. The seminar will focus on the
Chinatowns in North America and Southeast Asia, and
comparative analysis will be encouraged whenever
possible.
title: FS: Chinatowns: History and Myth
prerequisite:
1) At least a B4 for GCE ‘O’ level Chinese or Higher Chinese; OR  
2) A pass in GCE ‘A’ level H1 Chinese or H2 Chinese; OR 
3) Equivalent qualifications may be accepted.
